sourcing.instructions: Cs - Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in rare alkali metals. K - Purchase potassium from a chemical supplier or online chemical store. Na - Source sodium from a reputable chemical supply company. Se - Acquire selenium from a chemical supplier. Sn - Purchase tin from a metal supply store or chemical supplier.
steps: Cs - Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in rare alkali metals. K - Purchase potassium from a chemical supplier or online chemical store. Na - Source sodium from a reputable chemical supply company. Se - Acquire selenium from a chemical supplier. Sn - Purchase tin from a metal supply store or chemical supplier.

1. Weigh out 25.0 g of Cs in a fume hood. 2. Weigh 10.0 g of K and add it to a clean glass mixing container. 3. Measure 5.0 g of Na and combine with K in the container. 4. Add 80.0 g of Se to the mixture. 5. Finally, weigh and add 30.0 g of Sn. 6. Use a glass rod to mix the ingredients thoroughly until a homogenous mixture is obtained.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 25.0 g of Cs in a fume hood. 2. Weigh 10.0 g of K and add it to a clean glass mixing container. 3. Measure 5.0 g of Na and combine with K in the container. 4. Add 80.0 g of Se to the mixture. 5. Finally, weigh and add 30.0 g of Sn. 6. Use a glass rod to mix the ingredients thoroughly until a homogenous mixture is obtained.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace to a temperature of 800°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace to a temperature of 800°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the components.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature over a period of 4 hours. 2. Avoid any rapid cooling techniques to prevent cracking of the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature over a period of 4 hours. 2. Avoid any rapid cooling techniques to prevent cracking of the material.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth out any rough edges and achieve desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. If necessary, apply a sealant to protect the surface and enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth out any rough edges and achieve desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. If necessary, apply a sealant to protect the surface and enhance durability.
